roleInLitigation.summary: Contacts represent people involved in or affected by cases - client representatives, opposing counsel, government officers, and other stakeholders. They enable communication, case party identification, and client portal access.

lifecycle.role: Contacts linked to client become authorized representatives
lifecycle.impact: Wrong contact = communications to unauthorized persons

lifecycle.role: Opposing counsel and department officers tracked per case
lifecycle.impact: Missing contacts = incomplete case party records

lifecycle.role: Email, SMS, and notifications routed via contact info
lifecycle.impact: Stale info = failed delivery, missed deadlines

lifecycle.role: Primary contacts can receive client portal credentials
lifecycle.impact: Wrong portal access = confidential data breach

roleInLitigation.businessValue: Accurate contact data ensures communications reach the right people, portal access is properly controlled, and case parties are correctly identified.

systemDependencies.description: Contacts can be standalone (prospects) or linked to clients. They're referenced for portal access and communications.

dependencies.usage: Links contact to a client organization
dependencies.impactOfBadData: Contact appears unlinked, can't be used for client communications
Wrong person gets access to confidential case data
Failed delivery, bounced emails, privacy violations

dependencies.usage: Track all parties involved in litigation

contactTypes.description: Contacts can be standalone or client-linked with different use cases

types.description: Contact associated with a specific client (company representative)
types.useCase: Client employees, authorized signatories, billing contacts
types.visibility: Visible to all team members handling that client

types.description: Contact not linked to any client
types.useCase: Prospects, opposing counsel, government officers, other professionals

dataQualityRisks.cause: Import without deduplication, same person added for multiple clients
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Split communication history, redundant records, confusion
dataQualityRisks.prevention: Dedupe before import using email/phone match, search before create
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Merge duplicates preserving complete communication history

dataQualityRisks.consequence: Contact sees wrong cases in portal, communications go to wrong client
dataQualityRisks.prevention: Verify client before linking, double-check during portal provisioning
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Correct client_id, revoke incorrect portal access immediately

dataQualityRisks.cause: Personnel changes, no update after employee turnover
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Failed notifications, important updates not delivered
dataQualityRisks.prevention: Quarterly email verification, monitor bounce rates
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Update contact info, mark old email as secondary

dataQualityRisks.cause: Portal access granted to wrong contact or before identity verification
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Confidential case information exposed to unauthorized person
dataQualityRisks.prevention: Verify identity before portal provisioning, use OTP verification
dataQualityRisks.remediation: Immediately revoke access, audit activity logs, notify affected clients

dataQualityRisks.cause: Client deleted without cleaning up contacts
dataQualityRisks.consequence: Zombie records in system, can't be linked to cases

restrictions: Must verify identity before portal provisioning

permissions: Full CRUD for own clients' contacts
responsibilities: Manage contacts for their client relationships
restrictions: Cannot delete contacts linked to other users' cases

responsibilities: Add case party contacts as needed
Maintain contact info for assigned cases
Add opposing counsel during case work
Update contact info when changes noted

dataScopeGuidance.description: data_scope controls who can see standalone contacts

scopes.visibility: Only the creator can see this contact
scopes.useCase: Personal contacts, prospects being cultivated, sensitive relationships
scopes.recommendation: Use for prospects until they become clients

scopes.visibility: Creator and their direct reports can see
scopes.useCase: Team-shared resources like government contacts, panel advocates
scopes.recommendation: Use for contacts shared within a practice group

scopes.visibility: Everyone in the organization can see
scopes.useCase: Common contacts like court registries, shared service providers

dataScopeGuidance.note: Client-linked contacts inherit visibility from the client, data_scope is less relevant

contactRoles.description: Roles define the contact's function in client/case context

roles.description: Authorized to sign documents on behalf of client
roles.systemUse: Shown in signatory dropdowns for document generation

roles.description: Primary point of contact for case coordination
roles.systemUse: Receives task updates and deadline reminders

roles.description: Has authority to make case decisions

dataEntry: Verify email before marking as primary (send test if possible)
Use official email domains, not personal emails for business contacts
Store multiple phone numbers if available (office, mobile)
Assign all applicable roles, not just one
clientLinking: Link to client only when relationship is confirmed
Use standalone for prospects until client record is created
Verify correct client before linking (company name matching)
portalAccess: Verify identity before provisioning (ID check, OTP)
Explain portal features and access scope to contact
Review portal users quarterly, revoke inactive access
privacy: Honor data deletion requests via soft-delete with audit trail
Don't store sensitive personal information beyond necessary
Restrict access to personal contacts using OWN scope
deduplication: Run monthly duplicate check using email/phone match
When merging, preserve complete communication history
Update all case references to merged contact

troubleshooting.issue: Contact not appearing in client's contact list
troubleshooting.cause: Contact not linked to client (client_id is null)
troubleshooting.solution: Edit contact, set client_id to correct client

troubleshooting.issue: Portal access not working for contact
troubleshooting.cause: Portal user record not created or is_active is false
troubleshooting.solution: Check client_portal_users table, ensure record exists and is_active

troubleshooting.cause: Stale email address or email marked as bounced
troubleshooting.solution: Verify email is current, check bounce status in communication logs

troubleshooting.issue: Contact visible to wrong team members
troubleshooting.cause: data_scope set too broadly (ALL instead of OWN)

troubleshooting.solution: Use Admin merge tool to consolidate, update references

faqs.question: What's the difference between standalone and client-linked contacts?
faqs.answer: Standalone contacts are independent (prospects, opposing counsel). Client-linked contacts are associated with a specific client and inherit client visibility. Link when relationship is confirmed.

faqs.question: How do I give a contact portal access?
faqs.answer: Ensure contact is linked to a client, verify their identity, then use Portal Access provisioning. System creates auth credentials and portal_user record.

faqs.question: Can the same person be a contact for multiple clients?
faqs.answer: Currently, a contact can only be linked to one client. If same person represents multiple clients, create separate contact records or use standalone with case-level associations.

faqs.question: How do I handle a GDPR deletion request?
faqs.answer: Use soft-delete with audit trail documenting the request. System retains minimal records for legal compliance while removing from active use.

faqs.question: What happens if I mark wrong person as primary?
faqs.answer: Primary contacts receive important notifications. If wrong person marked, immediately update primary flag and review recent communications for any issues.
